author: bridge-bot
content:
<Klean_b> Hello @Benewagner @tcoratger 
I was looking at the key_gen function for GeneralizedXMSSSignatureScheme and i have 2a question about the RNG parameter.
Right now key_gen (and the underlying PRF / parameter generation) accepts any R: Rng, which  includes deterministic/test RNGs. I wrote a small test using a simple LCG-based RNG with a fixed seed and I was able to  fully reconstruct the secret key and forge valid signatures just by replaying the same seed and calling key_gen again. Is the intent that callers must always pass a cryptographically secure RNG here, even though the type bound is only R: Rng? If so, would it make sense to tighten this to require a CSPRNG at the type level, e.g.
pub fn key_gen<R: Rng + CryptoRng>(...)
(or R: CryptoRng + RngCore) to prevent accidental use of weak RNGs? or am I  missing something about why we need to support non-cryptographic RNGs here?

author: bridge-bot
content: <Benewagner> users should pick secure PRGs yes

author: bridge-bot
content: <Benewagner> Tightening the requirement may make sense, but is maybe bad for testing, idk.
